text: United States gubernatorial elections were held in 1915, in five states. Kentucky, Louisiana, Maryland and Mississippi held their gubernatorial elections in odd numbered years, every 4 years, preceding the United States presidential election year. Massachusetts elected its governors to a single- year term, switching to two years from the 1920 election. == Results == {| class="wikitable" |- ! State !! Incumbent !! Party !! Status !! Morrow (Republican) 48.96% L. L. Pickett (Prohibition) 0.94% Charles Dobbs (Socialist) 0.74% Fred J. Drexler (Progressive) 0.31% |- | Louisiana (Held, 18 April 1916) ||bgcolor="lightgrey"| Luther E. Walsh || Democratic || Defeated, 45.71% || Samuel W. McCall (Republican) 46.97% William Shaw (Prohibition) 3.90% Walter S. Hutchins (Socialist) 1.74% Nelson B. Clark (Progressive) 1.39% Peter O'Rourke (Socialist Labor) 0.29% |- | Mississippi ||bgcolor="lightgrey"| Earl L. Brewer || Democratic || Term-limited, Democratic victory || Theodore G. Bilbo (Democratic) 92.59% J. T. Lester (Socialist) 7.41% _(Democratic primary results)_ Theodore G. Bilbo 50.36% M. W. Reily 32.23% John R. Tally 7.73% H. M. Quinn 5.15% Peter Simpson Stovall 4.53% |} ==References== == Notes == Category:November 1915 events
title: 1915 United States gubernatorial elections
